TCNJ Home / Explore Programs / Data Science

Data Science

Degree

BS in Computer Science

School

Science

Department

Computer Science

At a Glance

Harness the power of large data sets as you dive into data wrangling, storage, and visualization while mastering foundational machine learning techniques like linear modeling, clustering, and dimensionality reduction. Gain the expertise to analyze and interpret complex data, empowering you to drive actionable insights and informed decision-making. This program, accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology, will equip you with the skills to tackle today’s most pressing computing challenges and launch a successful, rewarding career.

ApplyRequest Info

Undergraduate Program

Data Science Specialization
within computer science

You’ll Benefit From:

  • Small classes, project-based curricula, and an exceptional learning environment
  • Free electives to explore other academic and professional interests
  • A flexible, ABET-accredited curriculum
  • Opportunities to participate in faculty-mentored research and internships
  • Experiential learning in both the classroom and the community

Careers

You’ll graduate with the computing skills, knowledge, and practical experience to make you an ideal candidate for jobs at a wide variety of companies or for a spot at one of many top graduate schools. Your training — in a culture of deep engagement, research, and intense collaboration that closely models contemporary scientific practice — will ensure you’re equipped and ready for your future.

Many jobs in the field don’t require a graduate degree to be hired. Typical career paths include data analyst, data engineer, machine learning engineer, or data science generalist. You’ll be equipped to work in a variety of industries, including biotechnology, defense and military, energy, healthcare, telecommunication, and transportation.

Internships

Internships are an effective way to gain real-life experience, make connections, and have the potential to create long-term employment opportunities. Many TCNJ computer science students who pursued summer internships later received full-time job offers from those same firms after graduation.

Immersive Experiences

Career computer scientists and developers work across disciplines — with biologists or accountants, for instance — to create computational solutions for clients. You will follow that same collaborative and cross-disciplinary professional model in both project-based courses and a capstone experience as well as in research projects and internships. You will also gain real practice in the team-oriented, problem-focused nature of today’s workplace.
